location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘Route down the Tiban River from Karad to Majar (3 miles N. of Musemir.)’

mods.abstract: Reproduction of a black ink map showing the route taken by the Boundary Commission along the Tiban river valley [Wādī Tiban] from Karad, in a southerly direction, to Al Majar. The map features the topographical features in the immediate vicinity of the wadi only, including: lines indicating the form of the valley, cultivation, hills and promontories. Distances expressed in miles are marked along the route, and indicate the estimated distance from the route’s starting point at its camp at Karad. Notes below the map title give brief details of the journey, which was taken in December 1903.
